meanings.sent1: The prebound book was ready for the class before they even arrived.
meanings.sent2: The prebound notebook was neatly organized and prepared for the upcoming semester.
meanings.sent3: The prebound gift was wrapped and waiting for the birthday girl to open.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were prebound to the idea of success, driving her actions towards achieving her goals.
meanings.sent5: The prebound contract ensured that all terms were agreed upon before any work began.

meanings.definition: Already bound before sale or use
meanings.sent1: The prebound journal was on display at the bookstore.
meanings.sent2: The prebound textbook was popular among students for its durability.
meanings.sent3: The prebound puzzle was missing a piece, adding an unexpected challenge.
meanings.sent4: His emotions felt prebound, as if he already knew how he would react to the news.
meanings.sent5: The prebound bundle of newspapers was delivered to the door every morning.
